step.title: Configuration Management options
step.description: The options below allow you to configure the type of elements that are to be managed inside iTop.

choice.title: Configuration Management Base
choice.description: This module is always installed, it contains all the base objects that are mandatory in the iTop CMDB: Organizations, Locations, Teams, Persons, etc.

choice.title: End-User Devices
choice.description: This optional module manages end-user devices like Phones, Printers, Desktop PCs.

choice.title: Data Center Management
choice.description: This optional modules manages data center devices like Power Supplies, Racks, Enclosures.

step.title: Service Management options
step.description: Select the choice that best describes the relationships between the services and the IT infrastructure in your IT environment.

choice.title: Service Management for Enterprises
choice.description: Select this option if the IT delivers services based on a shared infrastructure. For example if different organizations within your company subscribe to services (like Mail and Print services) delivered by a single shared backend.

choice.title: Service Management for Service Providers
choice.description: Select this option if the IT manages the infrastructure of independent customers. This is the most flexible model, since the services can be delivered with a mix of shared and customer specific infrastructure devices.

step.title: Incident Management options
step.description: Select the type of tickets you want to use in order to respond to user requests and incidents.

choice.title: Simple Ticket Management
choice.description: Select this option to use one single type of tickets for all kind of requests.

choice.title: ITIL Compliant Tickets Management
choice.description: Select this option to have different types of ticket for managing user requests and incidents.

choice.title: Problem Management
choice.description: Manage problem ticket to solve recurring incidents.

choice.title: Known Error Database
choice.description: Manage Known Error tickets to document the possible root causes of incidents.

step.title: Change Management options
step.description: Select the type of tickets you want to use in order to manage changes to the IT infrastructure.

choice.title: ITIL Change Management
choice.description: Select this option to use Normal/Routine/Emergency change tickets.
